summary:
We need to produce JSON with keys: summary, business_intent, keywords (list). Must not list method names verbatim. Focus on class responsibility and state/behavior. Provide English.

We need to read docstring: JaxLayer is a Keras Layer that wraps a JAX model. Enables use of JAX components within Keras when using JAX as backend. Accepts call_fn, init_fn, params, state, seed. Handles signatures, initialization, stateful vs stateless models, RNG handling, training flag, etc. Also works with Haiku modules.

So summary: a Keras layer that integrates JAX functions/models, managing parameters, non-trainable state, RNG, and initialization, providing seamless use of JAX/Haiku models in Keras pipelines.

Business intent: allow developers to incorporate JAX models into Keras workflows, facilitating hybrid models, leveraging JAX performance while staying within Keras API, enabling training/inference with proper handling of parameters, state, RNG.

Keywords: Keras, JAX, layer, model wrapper, parameters, state, RNG, initialization, Haiku, backend, training, inference, PyTree, call function, init function, non-trainable state.

Make sure not to list method names verbatim. Provide JSON.

Summary: "A Keras layer that encapsulates a JAX model function, handling parameter and optional non‑trainable state initialization, RNG management, and training/inference mode, thereby allowing JAX (including Haiku) models to be used as native Keras layers."

Business intent: "Enable developers to integrate high‑performance JAX/Haiku models into Keras pipelines without rewriting code, supporting mixed‑framework training and inference while preserving Keras API compatibility."

Keywords list: ["Keras", "JAX", "layer wrapper", "model integration", "parameter management", "non‑trainable state", "random number generator", "initialization", "training mode", "inference mode", "Haiku", "PyTree", "backend compatibility"]
